ground_truth: More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines, claiming more victims. Asael fires his gun blind, the smoke obscuring his vision. Tuvia tosses a bag at Malvin and hares away across the field, his physical and mental strength restored. The two of them dive into thick woodland, moving behind the enemy lines, with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them. With murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward, gunning down every single man. Tuvia appropriates the German gun, takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line, and fires on the troops who are facing away from them, killing a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank gun is slowly turned in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the black mouth of the big gun moves near, Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree. A tank fires into the undergrowth behind him. More Germans zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode to the right and left of Tuvia, but miss their mark. Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree. The tank gun fires again, showering them both with gunpowder and debris. Malbin prepares an explosive. With gritted teeth, Malbin urges from behind the tree and runs at the tank, but is shot. The missile explodes around him. The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him. One soldier creeps nearer, but is shot in the back. His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus comes surging out of the trees, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him out of the trees and set about the rest. As the tank operator fires again, Zus clambers up onto the tank and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops to one side. Zus drops a grenade into the tank. His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously searching the trees. His men go through the dead soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: More cannonballs detonate the Bielski formations, taking more casualties. Asael discharges his weapon blind, the haze shrouding his sight. Tuvia flings a sack at Malvin and dashes away across the field, his bodily and mental vigor renewed. The duo plunge into dense forest, advancing behind the foe lines, with a view of the German troops and their tank before them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans pass by and establish a gun emplacement in front of them. With homicide in his eyes, Tuvia primes his machine gun and steps forward, mowing down every single man. Tuvia seizes the German weapon, assumes a position in the shrubbery behind the German line, and fires at the forces who are facing away from them, slaying a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank cannon is slowly aimed in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the dark aperture of the large cannon shifts near, Tuvia springs out of the way and dives behind a tree. A tank discharges into the shrubbery behind him. More Germans zip across the field and assume positions just yards away from them. Shells detonate to the right and left of Tuvia, but miss their target. Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree. The tank cannon discharges again, showering them both with gunpowder and wreckage. Malbin prepares an explosive. With clenched teeth, Malbin urges from behind the tree and sprints at the tank, but is shot. The projectile detonates around him. The helmeted Germans discharge in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him. One trooper creeps nearer, but is shot in the spine. His fellow forces glance behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a barricade of trees. Zus comes rushing out of the trees, single-handedly annihilating the Germans caught unprepared. The rest of his men pursue him out of the trees and tackle the remainder. As the tank operator discharges again, Zus scrambles up onto the tank and draws his sidearm. The tank operator flops to one side. Zus drops a grenade into the tank. His men spread across the field in frantic marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus rises to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously searching the trees. His men rummage through the deceased soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges from out of the misty haze, his piercing azure eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their weapons at the ready, raise their heads. Gradually, they begin to clamber to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny incline.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines, with more victims being claimed. Asael fires his gun blindly, and his vision is obscured by the smoke. A bag is tossed by Tuvia at Malvin, and he hares away across the field, with his physical and mental strength being restored. Thick woodland is dived into by the two of them, moving behind the enemy lines, and they see the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them. With murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward, bringing down every single man with gunfire. A German gun is appropriated by Tuvia, and he takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line, firing on the troops facing away from them, and he kills a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank gun slowly turns in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the black mouth of the big gun moves near, Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree. A shot is fired by a tank into the undergrowth behind him. More Germans zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode to the right and left of Tuvia, but they miss their mark. A nearby tree is cowered behind by Malbin. The tank gun fires again, and they are both showered with gunpowder and debris. An explosive is prepared by Malbin. With gritted teeth, Malbin urges himself from behind the tree and runs at the tank, but a shot hits him. The missile explodes around him. The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him. One soldier creeps nearer, but someone shoots him in the back. Their fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus surges out of the trees, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. His men follow him out of the trees and set about the rest. As the tank operator fires again, Zus clambers up onto the tank and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops to one side. A grenade is dropped by Zus into the tank. His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank, and his eyes anxiously search the trees. The dead soldiers' pockets are rummaged through by his men. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke, with his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads. Slowly, their feet scramble them to the top of the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Cannonballs explode along the Bielski lines, claiming more victims. Asael fires blindly, smoke obscuring his vision. Tuvia tosses a bag to Malvin and races across the field, his strength restored. They dive into thick woods, moving behind enemy lines, observing German soldiers and their tank. Crouching, they watch Germans set up a gun position. With murder in his eyes, Tuvia steps forward, gunning down every man. He takes the German gun, positions himself in the undergrowth, and fires on unsuspecting troops, killing many. The Germans regroup, turning the tank gun toward Tuvia and Malvin. As the gun nears, Tuvia leaps behind a tree. The tank fires, and more Germans take positions nearby. Shells explode around Tuvia, missing him. Malvin, cowering behind a tree, prepares an explosive. He charges the tank but is shot, and the missile explodes. Helmeted Germans fire at Tuvia, shells ricocheting off trees. A soldier creeps closer but is shot from behind. Guns fire from the trees as Zus emerges, decimating the Germans. His men follow, attacking the rest. As the tank fires, Zus climbs it, draws his pistol, and drops a grenade inside. His men spread across the field, firing on the remaining Germans. With none left standing, Zus anxiously searches the trees. His men search the dead soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges from the smoke, his piercing blue eyes scanning. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the hillside, raise their heads, scramble to their feet, and walk to the sunny slope's top.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Cannonballs explode the Bielski lines, claiming victims. Asael fires blindly through smoke. Tuvia throws a bag to Malvin and runs across the field, strength restored. They dive into woodland, observing German soldiers and a tank. Tuvia, with murder in his eyes, guns down Germans and takes their gun, firing on troops. The Germans regroup, turning the tank gun towards Tuvia and Malvin. Tuvia dives behind a tree as the tank fires. More Germans approach, shells exploding around Tuvia. Malvin, behind a tree, prepares an explosive but is shot as it detonates. Germans fire at Tuvia, but Zus emerges, decimating them. His men follow, attacking the rest. Zus climbs the tank, kills the operator, and drops a grenade inside. His men spread out, firing on remaining Germans. With none left standing, Zus searches the trees. His men search dead soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges, eyes darting. The Bielski Otriad, on the hill, raise their heads and walk to the sunny slope's top.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As more cannonballs continue to explode violently along the Bielski lines, they claim even more victims in their destructive wake. Asael, amidst the chaos, fires his gun blindly, his vision completely obscured by the thick, swirling smoke that envelops the battlefield. Meanwhile, Tuvia, with renewed physical and mental strength, tosses a bag at Malvin and swiftly hares away across the open field. The two of them dive into the dense, protective woodland, maneuvering stealthily behind the enemy lines, with a clear view of the German soldiers and their formidable tank looming ahead of them. They crouch down low as half a dozen German soldiers march past and proceed to set up a gun position directly in front of them. With a fierce determination and murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward with resolve, gunning down every single man in his path. Tuvia then appropriates the German gun, taking up a strategic position in the undergrowth behind the German line, and opens fire on the unsuspecting troops who are facing away from them, successfully killing a number of them. The Germans, in response, begin to regroup. The heavy tank gun is slowly and ominously turned in the direction of Tuvia and Malvin. As the black, menacing mouth of the big gun moves dangerously near, Tuvia leaps out of the way with agility and dives behind the safety of a sturdy tree. A tank fires into the undergrowth behind him, creating a deafening explosion. More German soldiers zip across the field with urgency and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode violently to the right and left of Tuvia, but miraculously miss their intended mark. Malbin, meanwhile, is cowering behind a nearby tree, seeking cover. The tank gun fires once again, showering them both with gunpowder and debris. With gritted teeth and determination, Malbin prepares an explosive. He urges himself from behind the tree and bravely runs at the tank, but is tragically shot. The missile explodes around him in a fiery burst. The helmeted Germans, relentless in their assault, fire in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him, creating a cacophony of noise. One soldier creeps nearer, but is swiftly shot in the back. His fellow troops, startled, look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus comes surging out of the trees with force, single-handedly decimating the Germans who are caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him out of the trees and set about dealing with the remaining enemy soldiers. As the tank operator fires once again, Zus clambers up onto the tank with determination and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops lifelessly to one side. Zus then drops a grenade into the tank, sealing its fate. His men spread across the field, alarmed but marching in step, and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one enemy left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously searching the trees for any sign of movement. His men go through the dead soldiers' pockets, searching for anything of value. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side, ever vigilant. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads in unison. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk with purpose to the top of the sunny slope, ready for whatever comes next.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As more and more cannonballs continue to explode violently along the Bielski lines, they relentlessly claim even more victims in their destructive wake, leaving chaos and devastation behind. Asael, amidst this tumultuous chaos, fires his gun wildly and without aim, his vision completely and utterly obscured by the thick, swirling smoke that envelops and chokes the battlefield. Meanwhile, Tuvia, infused with renewed physical and mental strength, tosses a heavy bag at Malvin and swiftly hares away across the wide open field. The two of them dive quickly into the dense, protective woodland, maneuvering stealthily behind the enemy lines, with a clear and unobstructed view of the German soldiers and their formidable tank looming ominously ahead of them. They crouch down low to the ground as half a dozen German soldiers march past them, proceeding to set up a gun position directly in front of them. With fierce determination and murder clearly visible in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward with unwavering resolve, gunning down every single man who stands in his path. Tuvia then seizes the German gun, taking up a strategic position in the dense undergrowth behind the German line, and opens fire on the unsuspecting troops who remain facing away from them, successfully killing a number of them. The Germans, in response, start to regroup hastily. The heavy tank gun is slowly and ominously turned in the threatening direction of Tuvia and Malvin. As the black, menacing mouth of the big gun moves dangerously near, Tuvia leaps out of the way with agility and dives behind the safety of a sturdy tree. A tank fires into the dense undergrowth behind him, creating a deafening explosion that reverberates through the air. More German soldiers zip across the field with urgency, taking up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode violently to the right and left of Tuvia, but miraculously miss their intended mark. Malbin, meanwhile, is cowering terrified behind a nearby tree, desperately seeking cover. The tank gun fires once again, showering them both with gunpowder and debris. With gritted teeth and unfaltering determination, Malbin prepares an explosive. He urges himself courageously from behind the tree and bravely runs at the tank, but is tragically shot in his attempt. The missile explodes around him in a fiery burst. The helmeted Germans, relentless in their assault, fire relentlessly in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him, creating a cacophony of noise. One soldier creeps ever nearer, but is swiftly shot in the back. His fellow troops are startled and look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus comes surging out of the trees with powerful force, single-handedly decimating the Germans who are caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him swiftly out of the trees, setting about dealing with the remaining enemy soldiers. As the tank operator fires once again, Zus clambers up onto the tank with determination and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops lifelessly to one side. Zus then drops a grenade decisively into the tank, sealing its grim fate. His men spread across the field, alarmed but marching in step, and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one enemy left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously searching the trees for any sign of movement. His men go through the pockets of the dead soldiers, searching for anything of value. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes darting cautiously from side to side, ever vigilant. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads in unison. Slowly and with purpose, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk with determination to the top of the sunny slope, ready and prepared for whatever comes next.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As more cannonballs explode along the Bielski lines, claiming additional victims, Asael blindly fires his gun into the chaos, the thick smoke obscuring his vision and making it difficult to aim. Meanwhile, Tuvia, with renewed physical and mental strength, tosses a bag to Malvin and swiftly sprints across the open field. The two of them dive into the dense woodland, maneuvering behind enemy lines, where they gain a clear view of the German soldiers and their tank positioned ahead. They crouch low to the ground as half a dozen German soldiers march past and set up a gun position directly in front of them. With a fierce determination and murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun, steps forward with resolve, and methodically guns down each man in the group. Afterward, Tuvia seizes the German gun, strategically positions himself within the undergrowth behind the German line, and opens fire on the unsuspecting troops, who are facing away from him, successfully killing several of them. As the Germans begin to regroup, the heavy tank gun slowly pivots in the direction of Tuvia and Malvin. Observing the ominous black mouth of the big gun moving closer, Tuvia quickly leaps out of harm's way and dives behind the protective cover of a tree. A tank shell is fired into the undergrowth behind him, narrowly missing its target. More German soldiers swiftly cross the field, taking up positions just yards away from Tuvia and Malvin. Explosive shells detonate to the right and left of Tuvia, but miraculously miss him. Malbin, cowering behind a nearby tree, prepares an explosive device with determination. With gritted teeth, he emerges from behind the tree and charges toward the tank, but is tragically shot before reaching his target. The missile he carries explodes around him, creating chaos. Helmeted German soldiers direct their fire toward Tuvia, with shells ricocheting off the trees surrounding him. As one soldier creeps closer, he is suddenly shot in the back, causing his fellow troops to momentarily glance behind them, distracted by gunfire coming from a wall of trees. In that moment, Zus surges out of the trees, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men follow his lead, emerging from the trees and engaging the remaining enemy soldiers. As the tank operator fires once more, Zus bravely clambers onto the tank and draws his pistol, shooting the operator, who slumps to one side. Seizing the opportunity, Zus drops a grenade into the tank, neutralizing the threat. His men spread across the field, marching in step and firing upon the remaining Germans. With no enemy left standing, Zus stands on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously scanning the trees for any remaining threats. Meanwhile, his men search through the dead soldiers' pockets for any useful items. Tuvia emerges from the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side, assessing the situation. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, cautiously raise their heads. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and make their way to the top of the sunny slope, ready to regroup and continue their fight.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Cannonballs explode along the Bielski lines, claiming more victims as Asael fires blindly through the smoke. Tuvia, revitalized, tosses a bag to Malvin and they dash into the thick woodland, positioning themselves behind enemy lines with a view of the German soldiers and their tank. As Germans set up a gun position nearby, Tuvia advances with determination, eliminating them and seizing their gun. He takes cover in the undergrowth and fires on the unsuspecting troops, killing several. The Germans regroup and turn their tank gun toward Tuvia and Malvin. Tuvia narrowly avoids the tank's fire by diving behind a tree, while Malvin, preparing an explosive, is shot as he charges the tank, causing a missile to explode around him. Amidst the chaos, Zus and his men launch a surprise attack from the trees, decimating the Germans. Zus climbs onto the tank, dispatches the operator, and drops a grenade inside. His men spread out, eliminating the remaining Germans. With the battlefield cleared, Zus anxiously scans the trees, while his men search the fallen soldiers. Tuvia emerges from the smoke, his eyes alert. The Bielski Otriad, lying in wait on the hillside, rise and move toward the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: More cannonballs explode along the Bielski lines, the defensive positions named after the Bielski partisans, a Jewish resistance group during World War II, claiming more victims. Asael fires his gun blind, the thick smoke of battle obscuring his vision. Tuvia, a leader known for his strategic acumen, tosses a bag at Malvin and hares away across the field, his physical and mental strength restored. The two of them dive into thick woodland, the dense forest area often used by partisans for cover and advantage, moving behind the enemy lines, providing them with a clear view of the German soldiers and their imposing tank ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them. With murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward, ruthlessly gunning down every single man. Tuvia appropriates the German gun, an MG42 known for its rapid fire rate, takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line, and fires on the troops who are facing away from them, killing a number of them. The Germans regroup with practiced precision. The heavy tank gun is slowly turned in Tuvia and Malvin's direction, its turret creaking ominously. As the black mouth of the big gun moves near, Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a sturdy tree. A tank fires a shell into the undergrowth behind him. More Germans, disciplined and trained, zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode to the right and left of Tuvia, but miss their mark. Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree. The tank gun fires again, showering them both with gunpowder and debris, a grim reminder of the tank's destructive power. Malbin prepares an explosive, a homemade grenade crafted from limited resources. With gritted teeth, Malbin urges from behind the tree and runs at the tank, but is shot. The missile explodes around him. The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction, their shots echoing in the forest. Shells ricochet off the trees around him. One soldier creeps nearer, but is shot in the back. His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns, likely other partisans joining the fight, fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus comes surging out of the trees, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men, well-coordinated and determined, follow him out of the trees and set about the rest. As the tank operator fires again, Zus clambers up onto the tank and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops to one side, hit. Zus drops a grenade into the tank, a dangerous yet effective tactic to disable it. His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes anxiously searching the trees for any signs of movement or threat. His men, ever vigilant, go through the dead soldiers' pockets for useful supplies. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side, ever watchful. The Bielski Otriad, lying strategically on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny slope, anticipating the next phase of their resistance.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. With gritted teeth Malbin urges from behind the tree and runs at the tank but is shot. The missile explodes around him. The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around him. One soldier creeps nearer but is shot in the back. His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus comes surging out of the trees singlehandedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him out of the trees and set about the rest. As the tank operator fires again Zus clambers up onto the tank and draws his pistol. The tank operator flops to one side. Zus drops a grenade into the tank. His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank his eyes anxiously searching the trees. His men go through the dead soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy smoke his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready raise their heads. Slowly they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines claiming more victims. Asael fires his gun blind the smoke obscuring his vision. Tuvia tosses a bag at Malvin and hares away across the field his physical and mental strength restored. The two of them dive into thick woodland moving behind the enemy lines with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them. With murder in his eyes Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward gunning down every single man. Tuvia appropriates. the German gun takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line and fires on the troops who are facing away from them killing a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank gun is slowly turned in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the black mouth of the big gun moves near Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree. A tank fires into the undergrowth behind him. More Germans zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode to the right and left of Tuvia but miss their mark. Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree. The tank gun fires again showering them both with gunpowder and debris. Malbin prepares an explosive. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines, claiming more victims. The dog fires his gun blind, the smoke obscuring its vision. The squirrel tosses a bag at the rabbit and hares away across the field, its physical and mental strength restored. The two of them dive into thick woodland, moving behind the enemy lines, with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them. With murder in its eyes, the squirrel cocks its machine gun and steps forward, gunning down every single man. The squirrel appropriates the German gun, takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line, and fires on the troops who are facing away from them, killing a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank gun is slowly turned in the squirrel and rabbit's direction. As the black mouth of the big gun moves near, the squirrel leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree. A tank fires into the undergrowth behind it. More Germans zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them. Shells explode to the right and left of the squirrel, but miss their mark. The owl is cowering behind a nearby tree. The tank gun fires again, showering them both with gunpowder and debris. The owl prepares an explosive. With gritted teeth, the owl urges from behind the tree and runs at the tank, but is shot. The missile explodes around it. The helmeted Germans fire in the squirrel's direction. Shells ricochet off the trees around it. One soldier creeps nearer, but is shot in the back. His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees. The fox comes surging out of the trees, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of its pack follow it out of the trees and set about the rest. As the tank operator fires again, the fox clambers up onto the tank and draws its pistol. The tank operator flops to one side. The fox drops a grenade into the tank. Its pack spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, the fox gets to its feet on the side of the tank, its eyes anxiously searching the trees. Its pack go through the dead soldiers' pockets. The squirrel emerges from out of the hazy smoke, its piercing blue eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready, raise their heads. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: More fireworks explode the Bielski lines, claiming more victims. Asael fires his slingshot blind, the fog obscuring his vision. Tuvia tosses a backpack at Malvin and hares away across the meadow, his physical and mental strength restored. The two of them dive into dense jungle, moving behind the enemy lines, with a view of the German soldiers and their jeep ahead of them. They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a catapult position in front of them. With murder in his eyes, Tuvia cocks his crossbow and steps forward, gunning down every single man. Tuvia appropriates the German slingshot, takes up a position in the bushes behind the German line, and fires on the troops who are facing away from them, killing a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy water gun is slowly turned in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the black mouth of the big water hose moves near, Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a boulder. A jeep fires into the bushes behind him. More Germans zip across the meadow and take up positions just yards away from them. Balloons explode to the right and left of Tuvia, but miss their mark. Malbin is cowering behind a nearby boulder. The water gun fires again, showering them both with confetti and debris. Malbin prepares a firework. With gritted teeth, Malbin urges from behind the boulder and runs at the jeep, but is shot. The balloon explodes around him. The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction. Confetti ricochets off the boulders around him. One soldier creeps nearer, but is shot in the back. His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as water pistols fire at them from behind a wall of shrubs. Zus comes surging out of the shrubs, single-handedly decimating the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him out of the shrubs and set about the rest. As the jeep operator fires again, Zus clambers up onto the jeep and draws his slingshot. The jeep operator flops to one side. Zus drops a sparkler into the jeep. His men spread across the meadow in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus gets to his feet on the side of the jeep, his eyes anxiously searching the shrubs. His men go through the dead soldiers' pockets. Tuvia emerges from out of the hazy mist, his piercing blue eyes darting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lying on the side of the dune with their slingshots at the ready, raise their heads. Slowly, they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny ridge.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: More cannonballs bounce off the Bielski lines, skipping over more victims. Asael wafts his gun in the air, the smoke tickling his vision. Tuvia lobs a bag at Malvin and strolls away across the field, his physical and mental strength untested. The two of them tiptoe into thick woodland, sliding behind the enemy lines, with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them. They stand up as half a dozen Germans wander past and set up a campfire in front of them. With confusion in his eyes, Tuvia juggles his machine gun and shuffles forward, serenading every single man. Tuvia snatches the German gun, settles into a hammock in the undergrowth behind the German line, and sings to the troops who are facing away from them, amusing a number of them. The Germans regroup. The heavy tank gun is slowly raised in Tuvia and Malvin's direction. As the black mouth of the big gun inches near, Tuvia dances out of the way and skips behind a tree. A tank spits into the undergrowth behind him. More Germans meander across the field and sit down just yards away from them. Shells pirouette to the right and left of Tuvia, but avoid their target. Malbin is reclining behind a nearby tree. The tank gun fires again, showering them both with sparkles and confetti. Malbin practices an acrobatic move. With gritted teeth, Malbin yawns from behind the tree and somersaults at the tank, but is startled. The firecracker explodes beside him. The helmeted Germans sketch in Tuvia's direction. Shells carom off the trees around him. One soldier twirls nearer, but is tagged in the back. His fellow troops scratch their heads for a split second as birds chirp at them from behind a wall of trees. Zus prances out of the trees, single-handedly dazzling the Germans caught off guard. The rest of his men follow him out of the trees and compose a melody for the rest. As the tank operator yawns again, Zus climbs up onto the tank and brushes his pistol. The tank operator lies down to one side. Zus tosses a flower into the tank. His men spread across the field in peculiar dancing in circles and giggle at the remaining Germans. With not one left standing, Zus floats to his feet on the side of the tank, his eyes whimsically scanning the trees. His men examine the dead soldiers' stories. Tuvia slides from out of the hazy smoke, his piercing blue eyes sparkling from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, reclining on the side of the hill with their guitars at the ready, lower their heads. Slowly, they begin to twirl to their feet and dance to the top of the sunny slope.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: More baubles ignite the Wilson lines, claiming more puppets. Alex fiddles his violin blind, the fog obscuring his perception. Trevor tosses a hat at Marvin and races away across the pasture, his physical and mental grace restored. The two of them leap into dense mangroves, moving behind the feline lines, with a view of the Roman artists and their cart ahead of them. They huddle down as half a dozen Romans come past and establish a fruit stand in front of them. With mystery in his eyes, Trevor clicks his typewriter and steps forward, scribbling down every single story. Trevor appropriates the Roman quill, takes up a position in the shadows behind the Roman line, and paints on the fences who are facing away from them, altering a number of them. The Romans reorganize. The hefty cart wheel is slowly turned in Trevor and Marvin's direction. As the white mouth of the large wheel moves near, Trevor leaps out of the path and dives behind a sculpture. A cart rolls into the shadows behind him. More Romans glide across the meadow and take up positions just feet away from them. Daisies burst to the right and left of Trevor, but miss their target. Marvin is quivering behind a nearby sculpture. The cart wheel rolls again, showering them both with stardust and fragments. Marvin prepares a potion. With clenched fists, Marvin eggs from behind the sculpture and runs at the cart, but is tagged. The potion shatters around him. The helmeted Romans scribble in Trevor's direction. Daisies bounce off the sculptures around him. One artist crawls nearer, but is tagged in the cape. His fellow creatives glance behind them for a split second as quills scribble at them from behind a wall of mangroves. Zach, whooshing out of the mangroves, single-handedly mesmerizing the Romans caught off guard. The rest of his poets follow him out of the mangroves and pen about the rest. As the cart navigator rolls again, Zach climbs up onto the cart and draws his marker. The cart navigator tilts to one side. Zach drops an eraser into the cart. His poets spread across the pasture in curious prancing in step and scribble on the remaining Romans. With not one left sketching, Zach gets to his feet on the side of the cart, his eyes anxiously scanning the mangroves. His poets sift through the silent artists' backpacks. Trevor emerges from out of the swirly fog, his piercing brown eyes scanning from side to side. The Wilson Ensemble, reclining on the side of the dune with their typewriters at the ready, lift their heads. Gradually, they begin to rise to their feet and wander to the top of the vibrant rise.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: More firecrackers illuminate the Bielski lines, mesmerizing more bystanders. A cat brandishes its paintbrush wildly, the mist camouflaging its gaze. A squirrel flings a feather at Marvin and gallops across the meadow, its energy and vigor renewed. The two of them sway into dense grassland, drifting behind the rival lines, with a perspective of the French knights and their carriage ahead of them. They stretch upward as half a dozen minstrels strut past and set up a music station in front of them. With glee in its eyes, the squirrel strums its ukulele and prances forward, serenading every single minstrel. The squirrel borrows the minstrel’s lute, takes up a corner in the shrubbery behind the minstrel line, and serenades as the players who are facing away from them dance to the tune, captivating a number of them. The players reorganize. The bulky drum is gently rolled in the squirrel and Marvin’s direction. As the dark rim of the large drum inches nearer, the squirrel somersaults aside and jives behind a boulder. A carriage bellows into the shrubbery behind it. More jesters dart across the meadow and form a circle just feet away from them. Cymbals clash to the left and right of the squirrel, but miss their harmony. Marvin is hiding behind a nearby boulder. The drum beats again, showering them both with confetti and petals. Marvin assembles a piñata. With clenched fists, Marvin whispers from behind the boulder and skips toward the carriage, but is doused. The piñata bursts around it. The helmeted jesters cheer in the squirrel's direction. Cymbals bounce off the boulders around it. One singer glides nearer, but is poked in the back. Its fellow jesters glance behind them for a split second as trumpets blare at them from behind a row of boulders. Zeus comes leaping out of the boulders, single-handedly enchanting the jesters caught unaware. The rest of his crew follow him out of the boulders and engage the rest. As the carriage driver toots again, Zeus vaults up onto the carriage and brandishes its harmonica. The carriage driver slumps to one side. Zeus tosses a bouquet into the carriage. His crew spread across the meadow in euphoric prancing in sync and delight in the remaining jesters. With not one left frolicking, Zeus springs to his feet on the side of the carriage, his eyes joyfully scanning the boulders. His crew rummage through the jesters’ satchels. The squirrel materializes from out of the swirling mist, its bright green eyes flitting from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, lounging on the side of the knoll with their ukuleles at the ready, lift their instruments. Slowly, they begin to waltz to their feet and promenade to the peak of the sunny ridge.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: More watermelons burst within the Bielski area, capturing more bystanders. Asael tosses his spear blindly, the mist concealing his sight. Tuvia flings a lantern at Malvin and scampers away across the courtyard, his physical and mental agility renewed. The two of them leap into dense meadow, weaving behind the rival boundary, with a glimpse of the German actors and their carriage ahead of them. They kneel down as half a dozen Germans stroll past and construct a barrier position in front of them. With lightning in his eyes, Tuvia swings his slingshot and steps forward, hurling stones at every single figure. Tuvia seizes the German crossbow, takes up a stance in the brambles behind the German crowd, and flings at the captives who are looking away from them, stunning a number of them. The Germans reassemble. The heavy cart wheel slowly spins in Tuvia and Malvin's trajectory. As the dark mouth of the large device swings near, Tuvia hops out of the way and rolls behind a bush. A pistol shoots into the brambles behind him. More Germans sprint across the courtyard and stake positions just meters away from them. Vapors pop to the right and left of Tuvia, but miss their aim. Malbin is trembling behind a close shrub. The large device shoots again, dusting them both with sawdust and fragments. Malbin concocts a mixture. With clenched fists, Malbin summons from behind the shrub and dashes at the cart, but is injured. The balloon bursts around him. The helmeted Germans toss in Tuvia's path. Vapors bounce off the bushes around him. One actor sneaks closer, but is struck in the spine. His fellow actors glance behind them for a brief moment as arrows whistle at them from behind a barrier of greenery. Zus bursts from the greenery, single-handedly scattering the Germans caught unprepared. The remainder of his crew follows him from the greenery and set upon the others. As the carriage driver whistles again, Zus scrambles up onto the carriage and draws his dagger. The carriage driver slumps to one side. Zus slips a stone into the carriage. His crew spread across the courtyard in anxious marches and shoot at the remaining Germans. With not one standing tall, Zus rises to his feet on the side of the carriage, his eyes keenly scanning the greenery. His crew rummages through the fallen actors' satchels. Tuvia steps out from the misty cloud, his piercing blue eyes flicking from side to side. The Bielski Otriad, sprawled on the side of the hill with their bows at the ready, lift their gazes. Gradually, they begin to rise to their feet and stroll to the top of the bright incline.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: More fireflies illuminate the Smithy pathways, attracting more moths. Gerald tosses his dart gingerly, the haze clearing his focus. Victor hurls a pebble at Marvin and races away across the meadow, his emotional and intellectual fatigue lifted. The pair of them scuttle into dense shrubbery, sneaking behind the playgroup, with a view of the French officers and their cart ahead of them. They huddle down as several Italians stroll by and create a trench in front of them. With comedy in his expression, Victor strums his banjo and skips forward, serenading every single deer. Victor borrows the French harmonica, takes a stance in the clover behind the French line, and plays for the spectators who are looking away from them, delighting a number of them. The French regroup. The heavy drum solo is slowly adjusted in Victor and Marvin's direction. As the loud beat of the big drum approaches, Victor leaps out of the scene and sprints behind a bush. A tuba blares into the clover behind him. More Italians hover over the meadow and stake territories just feet away from them. Firecrackers pop to the north and south of Victor, but avoid their target. Marvin is trembling behind a nearby bush. The drum solo thunders again, covering them both with confetti and feathers. Marvin prepares a kite. With clenched fists, Marvin jumps from behind the bush and dashes at the band, but is tickled. The balloon explodes alongside him. The helmeted Italians giggle in Victor's direction. Polka dots scatter off the bushes around him. One dancer sneaks closer, but is hugged from behind. Her fellow performers glance over for a brief moment as trumpets blare at them from behind a curtain of roses. Leslie comes bursting out of the roses, single-handedly embracing the Italians caught unaware. The rest of his clowns follow him out of the roses and entertain the rest. As the drum player thumps again, Leslie climbs up onto the drum kit and brandishes his trombone. The drum player collapses to one side. Leslie drops a kazoo into the drum set. His clowns scatter over the meadow in astonished skipping steps and perform for the remaining Italians. With not one left tapping, Leslie rises to his heels on the side of the drum, his eyes eagerly scanning the roses. His clowns search through the dazzled performers' pockets. Victor emerges from out of the misty bubbles, his bright green eyes flickering from corner to corner. The Smithy Band, perched on the side of the hill with their instruments at the ready, lower their masks. Slowly, they begin to hop to their toes and leap to the top of the grassy knoll.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Cannonballs bombard the Bielski lines, causing chaos and casualties. Asael blindly fires his gun amid the smoke. Meanwhile, Tuvia, regaining strength, moves with Malvin into enemy territory, killing German soldiers and seizing their weapon. As the Germans regroup, a tank targets them. Tuvia narrowly escapes as shells explode nearby, while Malvin is shot during a courageous charge with an explosive, detonating around him. Zus arrives, surprising the Germans by storming in and dismantling them. Climbing onto a tank, Zus deals with the operator and drops a grenade inside. His men eliminate the remaining soldiers and search their pockets. Tuvia emerges from the smoke, joining the Bielski Otriad, who rise and advance to the hilltop.

behind the tree and runs at the tank but is shot  Malbin prepares an explosive  The tank gun fires again showering them both with gunpowder and debris  Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree  Shells explode to the right and left of Tuvia but miss their mark  More Germans zip across the field and take up positions just yards away from them  A tank fires into the undergrowth behind him  As the black mouth of the big gun moves near Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree  The heavy tank gun is slowly turned in Tuvia and Malvin's direction  The Germans regroup  the German gun takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line and fires on the troops who are facing away from them killing a number of them  Tuvia appropriates  With murder in his eyes Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward gunning down every single man  They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them  The two of them dive into thick woodland moving behind the enemy lines with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them  Tuvia tosses a bag at Malvin and hares away across the field his physical and mental strength restored  Asael fires his gun blind the smoke obscuring his vision  More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines claiming more victims

appropriates  The tank operator flops to one side  the German gun takes up a position in the undergrowth behind the German line and fires on the troops who are facing away from them killing a number of them  His fellow troops look behind them for a split second as guns fire at them from behind a wall of trees  More cannonballs explode the Bielski lines claiming more victims  The missile explodes around him  Malbin prepares an explosive  With murder in his eyes Tuvia cocks his machine gun and steps forward gunning down every single man  The Bielski Otriad lying on the side of the hill with their guns at the ready raise their heads  His men spread across the field in alarmed marching in step and fire on the remaining Germans  They crouch down as half a dozen Germans come past and set up a gun position in front of them  Shells ricochet off the trees around him  One soldier creeps nearer but is shot in the back  As the tank operator fires again Zus clambers up onto the tank and draws his pistol  With not one left standing Zus gets to his feet on the side of the tank his eyes anxiously searching the trees  Slowly they begin to scramble to their feet and walk to the top of the sunny slope Malbin is cowering behind a nearby tree  Asael fires his gun blind the smoke obscuring his vision  The Germans regroup  The helmeted Germans fire in Tuvia's direction  Zus comes surging out of enemy lines with a view of the German soldiers and their tank ahead of them  As the black mouth of the big gun moves near Tuvia leaps out of the way and dives behind a tree  The rest of his men follow Tuvia and Malvin's direction  With gritted teeth Malbin urges from behind the tree and runs at the tank but is shot
